metadata.notes: The text is a classic example of Liberation Theology homiletics, focusing on class struggle and socio-political hermeneutics.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher operates from a strong 'Critical Parent' position, establishing rigid dogmatic boundaries. There is a clear 'must' (Soll-Bestimmung) regarding how to interpret the text. The preacher judges the 'bourgeoisie' and 'neutral exegesis' as morally deficient.
quotes: Das geht nicht kostenfrei, und darum ist eine klassenneutrale Auslegung dieses Textes unmöglich.
Nur wenn wir uns zu diesen Inhalten... neu verhalten, dann gewinnen wir Anteil an ihr.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: Nurturing Parent is present but strictly conditional and collective. Care is directed toward the 'oppressed' (Victims), but it is a 'challenging' care that demands solidarity rather than providing immediate comfort to the listener.
quotes: Wenn der Geist Christi wirklich der ist, der den Kindern von Soweto verspricht, dass sie Befreiung erfahren...

adult.analysis: The preacher uses logical, socio-economic analysis (Adult data processing) to deconstruct traditional exegesis. However, the Adult is often 'contaminated' by the Parent; the logic is used to support a pre-determined ideological conclusion rather than open-ended inquiry.
quotes: Zu einem Text gehören immer die, die ihn gebrauchen, dazu. Für wen ist ein Text geschrieben worden?

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher invites the congregation into an 'Adapted Child' role—specifically the 'Guilty Child.' The listener is made to feel that their previous understanding of the gospel was a 'trick' and they must now comply with the new socio-political demand to be 'saved.'
quotes: Das 'für alle' ist ein Trick der Bourgeoisie...
Nur wenn wir solidarisch mit denen werden... dann gilt sie auch uns.

free_child_FC.analysis: There is almost no Free Child presence. The tone is heavy, serious, and revolutionary. There is no room for spontaneity, play, or the 'unmerited joy' of the gospel outside of political struggle.

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher speaks as a Critical Parent to an Adapted/Guilty Child. While the social level appears to be Adult-Adult (theological/sociological lecture), the psychological level is Parent-Child: 'I know the truth about your privilege, and you must repent through political alignment.'
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: The 'Social' message is about biblical interpretation; the 'Psychological' message is: 'You are currently excluded from grace unless you adopt my political framework.'
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'double bottom' lies in the definition of grace. Grace is offered (Social), but then immediately conditioned upon political solidarity (Psychological/Law).

detected_games.name: Bait & Switch (Redemption)

formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's desire to be a 'good person' and part of God's promise.
formula_g_analysis.switch: The definition of 'all' is revealed as a 'trick'; grace is narrowed to a specific class.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The listener feels excluded/guilty (Payoff: Guilt) unless they submit to the preacher's political program.

evidence_quotes: Dieser Text ist für die Armen geschrieben, nicht »für alle«.
Nur wenn wir solidarisch mit denen werden... dann gilt sie auch uns.

detected_games.name: NIGYSOB (Now I've Got You, You Son of a Bitch)

formula_g_analysis.con: Inviting the listener to reflect on 'normal exegesis'.
formula_g_analysis.switch: Labeling the listener's traditional view as a 'trick of the bourgeoisie'.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: Moral superiority of the preacher over the 'blind' middle-class listener.

evidence_quotes: Das 'für alle' ist ein Trick der Bourgeoisie, sich auch noch dessen zu bemächtigen, was anderen gegolten hat.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: N/A - The text is heavily structured around the 'Bait & Switch' of universal grace vs. class-specific promise.

preacher_roles.rescuer: High. The preacher presents themselves as the one who will rescue the 'Armen' and also rescue the 'Reichen' from their false exegesis.
preacher_roles.persecutor: High. The preacher attacks the 'Bourgeoisie' and 'interklassizistische Exegese' as deceptive and harmful.
preacher_roles.victim: Low. The preacher identifies with the victims (the oppressed) but speaks from a position of power (the pulpit).

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is pushed into the 'Persecutor' role (as part of the oppressive system) and then offered the 'Victim' role (spiritually poor) to be 'Rescued' by the preacher's new ideology.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: Minimal. The only escape offered is 'solidarity,' which in this context is another form of compliance to the Parent's demands.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: While theologically significant in its historical context, the sermon is psychologically coercive. it utilizes a 'Bait & Switch' game where the universal promise of the Gospel is used as a hook to induce class-based guilt. The preacher dominates from a Critical Parent position, leaving little room for the listener's Adult ego to reflect or for the Free Child to experience grace without conditions. It creates a dependency on the preacher's specific political hermeneutic for spiritual security.
strengths: Clear identification with the marginalized (Nurturing Parent toward the 'Victim').
areas_for_improvement: High level of 'Must-urbatory' language (Klassenneutrale Auslegung ist unmöglich).
Heavy use of guilt as a motivational tool.
Narrowing of the 'Adult' space for the listener.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Try to present the socio-political implications as a 'Response' of the Free Child to experienced grace, rather than a 'Condition' imposed by the Critical Parent. Move from 'You must be solidarity' to 'What does this reality mean for us here and now?' (Adult-Adult).
